senses.de: to make something more clearly understood or more noticeable
senses.ex: She emphasized that she will not tolerate any kind of misconduct.

Tips.title: Visual Imagery
Tips.description: Using 'emphasize' can help create a strong mental picture to remember details or concepts.
Tips.example: The illustration emphasizes the cycle of water evaporation and rainfall.

Tips.title: Argument Strength
Tips.description: Use 'emphasize' to make your argument or point of view stand out more clearly.
Tips.example: In the debate, he emphasized the benefits of renewable energy.

Tips.title: Clarifying Misunderstandings
Tips.description: 'Emphasize' can be used to clarify a point that might have been misunderstood or overlooked.
Tips.example: I want to emphasize that my earlier comment was about efficiency, not cost.

senses.ex: The lecturer emphasized the importance of reading widely

Tips.title: Academic Writing
Tips.description: In academic contexts, 'emphasize' is often used to point out critical ideas or findings.
Tips.example: The study emphasizes the link between diet and health.

Tips.title: Speech Delivery
Tips.description: When speaking, you can emphasize a point with your tone of voice or body language.
Tips.example: He emphasized his main point by raising his voice.

Tips.title: Importance
Tips.description: 'Emphasize' signals the listener or reader to pay extra attention to something you consider important.
Tips.example: During the tour, the guide emphasized the safety rules.

Accent.wordDefinition:
Accent means to give extra prominence or stress to a specific sound or syllable while speaking. For example, when speaking a foreign language, one might need to accentuate certain sounds to sound more natural.

So, while accent refers to the pronunciation of a specific sound, emphasize refers to the importance or significance of a word or phrase.

Accentuate.wordDefinition:
Accentuate means to make something more noticeable or prominent by emphasizing its important or distinctive features. You can think of it as highlighting something in a way that makes it stand out.

For example, wearing a colorful dress to accentuate your eyes or using bold font to accentuate a key point in a presentation.

Accentuate is about making something stand out while emphasize is about underscoring its importance.

Highlight.wordDefinition:
Highlight means to mark or draw attention to something.

It is generally used when you want to make something more noticeable or provide additional context. For example, a journalist may highlight a key quote in an article to make it more memorable for readers.

Both words can be used in various contexts, but emphasize is more for putting weight and importance on a particular thing, and highlight is more about bringing attention to something important or noteworthy.

Reinforce.wordDefinition:
Reinforce means to strengthen or support something. For example, a coach might reinforce the team's strategy by reminding them of their training.

Emphasize is used when you want to make something more prominent or significant, while reinforce is used when you want to make something stronger or more effective.

Reiterate.wordDefinition:
Reiterate means to repeat something that has already been said or done in order to emphasize its importance or make it clearer.

Both words are applicable in different situations, but the main difference between them is that emphasize is used to bring attention to something that hasn't been mentioned yet, while reiterate is used to emphasize something that has already been said.

Spotlight.wordDefinition:
Spotlight means to shine a light or focus on something to make it visible or prominent.

For example - The media spotlighted the issue of pollution in the city.

Emphasize is used to highlight importance, and spotlight is used to focus on something to make it visible or prominent.

Stress.wordDefinition:
Meanwhile, stress is often used when the situation is more intense or urgent, and implies a higher level of pressure.

For example, a coach may emphasize the importance of teamwork to their players, while a survivor of a natural disaster might stress the urgent need for food and shelter.

Underline.wordDefinition:
Underline means to highlight or mark the text or a part of it with a line underneath.

So in short, emphasize is used to give importance to a specific point whereas underline is used to draw attention to certain words or phrases in a text.

quotes.Text: We can make a commitment to promote vegetables and fruits and whole grains on every part of every menu. We can make portion sizes smaller and emphasize quality over quantity. And we can help create a culture - imagine this - where our kids ask for healthy options instead of resisting them.
quotes.Title: American First Lady
quotes.Name: Michelle Obama

quotes.Text: One of the lessons of leadership worth emphasizing is that you want to get to know other great leaders and take their advice. At some point in your development, it's only people who've been in the seat of having to be leaders who can help you in a deep way.
quotes.Title: South Korean Public Servant
quotes.Name: Jim Yong Kim

quotes.Text: Your personality as the prime minister feeds through to what you emphasise, and what you don't, how you'll handle a situation - whether you've got the combination of intelligence or instincts to adapt and to make good decisions.
quotes.Title: New Zealander Politician
quotes.Name: John Key

quotes.Text: Life insurance became popular only when insurance companies stopped emphasizing it as a good investment and sold it instead as a symbolic commitment by fathers to the future well-being of their families.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: James Surowiecki

quotes.Text: I emphasize self-esteem, self-confidence, and dignity, not as an ideal, but as a real test of community organization. Without leadership development, community organizations do not have staying power.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Paul Wellstone

quotes.Text: I have advocated an entirely different approach than cap and tax, which would be worldwide in application and which emphasizes technology as a way of reducing total emissions.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Jim Sensenbrenner

quotes.Text: And that is why marriage and family law has emphasized the importance of marriage as the foundation of family, addressing the needs of children in the most positive way.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: John Boehner

quotes.Text: I can't emphasize how important free speech is to a liberal and free democracy.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Hasan Minhaj

quotes.Text: I want to emphasize that character in our leaders does matter.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Bill Haslam

quotes.Text: I cannot emphasize enough the importance of a good teacher.
quotes.Title: American Educator
quotes.Name: Temple Grandin
